children.comments: NOTE: The semigroup instance uses `merge` NOT `concat`.
children.title: semigroupAsyncSubject

declarations.comments:
Please see [RxJS Version 5.* documentation](http://reactivex.io/rxjs/) for
additional details on proper usage of the library.
declarations.title: AsyncSubject

declarations.comments: Makes every `next` call run in the new Scheduler.
declarations.title: observeOn

declarations.comments: Makes subscription happen on a given Scheduler.
declarations.title: subscribeOn

declarations.comments:
Subscribing to an AsyncSubject is like calling a function, providing
`next`, `error` and `completed` effects to which the data will be delivered.
declarations.title: subscribe

declarations.comments:
Creates an AsyncSubject that emits the value specify,
and then emits a complete notification.  An alias for `of`.
declarations.title: just

declarations.comments: Create an Observable from a AsyncSubject
declarations.title: asObservable

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the first AsyncSubject into an Array, and emits that array only when
second AsyncSubject emits.
declarations.title: buffer

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the past as an array, emits that array when
its size (arg1) reaches the specified buffer size, and starts a new buffer.
The new buffer starts with nth (arg2) element of the AsyncSubject counting
from the beginning of the *last* buffer.
declarations.title: bufferCount

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the source AsyncSubject (arg1) as an array. Starts collecting only when
the opening (arg2) AsyncSubject emits, and calls the closingSelector function (arg3) to get an AsyncSubject
that decides when to close the buffer.  Another buffer opens when the
opening AsyncSubject emits its next value.
declarations.title: bufferToggle

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the past as an array. When it starts collecting values,
it calls a function that returns an AsyncSubject that emits to close the
buffer and restart collecting.
declarations.title: bufferWhen

declarations.comments:
Equivalent to mergeMap (a.k.a, `>>=`) EXCEPT that, unlike mergeMap,
the next bind will not run until the AsyncSubject generated by the projection function (arg2)
completes.  That is, composition is sequential, not concurrent.
Warning: if source values arrive endlessly and faster than their corresponding
inner AsyncSubjects can complete, it will result in memory issues as inner
AsyncSubjects amass in an unbounded buffer waiting for their turn to be subscribed to.
declarations.title: concatMap

declarations.comments: The type signature explains it best.  Warning: Like `concatMap`, composition is sequential.
declarations.title: concatMapTo

declarations.comments:
It's Like concatMap (a.k.a, `>>=`) EXCEPT that it ignores every new projected
AsyncSubject if the previous projected AsyncSubject has not yet completed.
declarations.title: exhaustMap

declarations.comments:
It's similar to mergeMap, but applies the projection function to every source
value as well as every output value. It's recursive.
declarations.title: expand

declarations.comments:
Groups the items emitted by an AsyncSubject (arg2) according to the value
returned by the grouping function (arg1).  Each group becomes its own
AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: groupBy

declarations.comments:
Emits the given constant value on the output AsyncSubject every time
the source AsyncSubject emits a value.
declarations.title: mapTo

declarations.comments:
Maps each value to an AsyncSubject, then flattens all of these AsyncSubjects
using mergeAll.  It's just monadic `bind`.
declarations.title: mergeMap

declarations.comments:
Maps each value of the AsyncSubject (arg1) to the same inner AsyncSubject (arg2),
then flattens the result.
declarations.title: mergeMapTo

declarations.comments: Puts the current value and previous value together as an array, and emits that.
declarations.title: pairwise

declarations.comments:
Given a predicate function (arg1), and an AsyncSubject (arg2), it outputs a
two element array of partitioned values
(i.e., [ AsyncSubject valuesThatPassPredicate, AsyncSubject valuesThatFailPredicate ]).
declarations.title: partition

declarations.comments:
Given an accumulator function (arg1), an initial value (arg2), and
a source AsyncSubject (arg3), it returns an AsyncSubject that emits the current
accumlation whenever the source emits a value.
declarations.title: scan

declarations.comments:
Projects each source value to an AsyncSubject which is merged in the output
AsyncSubject, emitting values only from the most recently projected AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: switchMap

declarations.comments: It's like switchMap, but maps each value to the same inner AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: switchMapTo

declarations.comments: It's like buffer, but emits a nested AsyncSubject instead of an array.
declarations.title: window

declarations.comments: It's like bufferCount, but emits a nested AsyncSubject instead of an array.
declarations.title: windowCount

declarations.comments:
It's like bufferTime, but emits a nested AsyncSubject instead of an array,
and it doesn't take a maximum size parameter.  arg1 is how long to
buffer items into a new AsyncSubject, arg2 is the when the next buffer should begin,
and arg3 is the source AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: windowTime

declarations.comments: It's like bufferToggle, but emits a nested AsyncSubject instead of an array.
declarations.title: windowToggle

declarations.comments: It's like bufferWhen, but emits a nested AsyncSubject instead of an array.
declarations.title: windowWhen

declarations.comments: It's like auditTime, but the silencing duration is determined by a second AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: audit

declarations.comments:
Ignores source values for duration milliseconds,
then emits the most recent value from the source AsyncSubject, then repeats this process.
declarations.title: auditTime

declarations.comments:
It's like debounceTime, but the time span of emission silence is determined
by a second AsyncSubject.  Allows for a variable debounce rate.
declarations.title: debounce

declarations.comments: It's like delay, but passes only the most recent value from each burst of emissions.
declarations.title: debounceTime

declarations.comments:
Returns an AsyncSubject that emits all items emitted by the source AsyncSubject
that are distinct by comparison from previous items.
declarations.title: distinct

declarations.comments:
Returns an AsyncSubject that emits all items emitted by the source AsyncSubject
that are distinct by comparison from the previous item.
declarations.title: distinctUntilChanged

declarations.comments:
Emits the single value at the specified index in a sequence of emissions
from the source AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: elementAt

declarations.comments:
Filter items emitted by the source AsyncSubject by only emitting those that
satisfy a specified predicate.
declarations.title: filter

declarations.comments: Ignores all items emitted by the source AsyncSubject and only passes calls of complete or error.
declarations.title: ignoreElements

declarations.comments: Returns an AsyncSubject that emits only the last item emitted by the source AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: last

declarations.comments: It's like sampleTime, but samples whenever the notifier AsyncSubject emits something.
declarations.title: sample

declarations.comments:
Periodically looks at the source AsyncSubject and emits whichever
value it has most recently emitted since the previous sampling, unless the source has not emitted anything since the previous sampling.
declarations.title: sampleTime

declarations.comments: Returns an AsyncSubject that skips n items emitted by an AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: skip

declarations.comments: Returns an AsyncSubject that skips items emitted by the source AsyncSubject until a second AsyncSubject emits an item.
declarations.title: skipUntil

declarations.comments:
Returns an AsyncSubject that skips all items emitted
by the source AsyncSubject as long as a specified condition holds true,
but emits all further source items as soon as the condition becomes false.
declarations.title: skipWhile

declarations.comments: Emits only the first n values emitted by the source AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: take

declarations.comments: Lets values pass until a second AsyncSubject emits something. Then, it completes.
declarations.title: takeUntil

declarations.comments:
Emits values emitted by the source AsyncSubject so long as each value satisfies
the given predicate, and then completes as soon as this predicate is not satisfied.
declarations.title: takeWhile

declarations.comments: It's like throttleTime, but the silencing duration is determined by a second AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: throttle

declarations.comments:
Emits a value from the source AsyncSubject, then ignores subsequent source values
for duration milliseconds, then repeats this process.
declarations.title: throttleTime

declarations.comments: An AsyncSubject of projected values from the most recent values from each input AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: combineLatest

declarations.comments: Concatenates two AsyncSubjects together by sequentially emitting their values, one AsyncSubject after the other.
declarations.title: concat

declarations.comments: Converts a higher-order AsyncSubject into a first-order AsyncSubject by concatenating the inner AsyncSubjects in order.
declarations.title: concatAll

declarations.comments:
Flattens an AsyncSubject-of-AsyncSubjects by dropping the next inner AsyncSubjects
while the current inner is still executing.
declarations.title: exhaust

declarations.comments: Creates an output AsyncSubject which concurrently emits all values from each input AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: merge

declarations.comments:
Converts a higher-order AsyncSubject into a first-order AsyncSubject
which concurrently delivers all values that are emitted on the inner AsyncSubjects.
declarations.title: mergeAll

declarations.comments:
Returns an AsyncSubject that mirrors the first source AsyncSubject to emit an
item from the array of AsyncSubjects.
declarations.title: race

declarations.comments:
Returns an AsyncSubject that emits the items in the given Array before
it begins to emit items emitted by the source AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: startWith

declarations.comments:
Combines each value from the source AsyncSubjects using a project function to
determine the value to be emitted on the output AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: withLatestFrom

declarations.comments:
Waits for each AsyncSubject to emit a value. Once this occurs, all values
with the corresponding index will be emitted. This will continue until at
least one inner AsyncSubject completes.
declarations.title: zip

declarations.comments:
If the source AsyncSubject calls error, this method will resubscribe to the
source AsyncSubject n times rather than propagating the error call.
declarations.title: retry

declarations.comments: Time shifts each item by some specified amount of milliseconds.
declarations.title: delay

declarations.comments:
Delays the emission of items from the source AsyncSubject by a given time
span determined by the emissions of another AsyncSubject.
declarations.title: delayWhen

declarations.comments:
Performs the effect on each value of the AsyncSubject.  An alias for `do`.
Useful for testing (transparently performing an effect outside of a subscription).
declarations.title: performEach

declarations.comments: Counts the number of emissions on the source and emits that number when the source completes.
declarations.title: count

children.comments: NOTE: The semigroup instance uses `merge` NOT `concat`.
children.title: semigroupBehaviorSubject

declarations.comments:
Please see [RxJS Version 5.* documentation](http://reactivex.io/rxjs/) for
additional details on proper usage of the library.
declarations.title: BehaviorSubject

declarations.comments: Makes every `next` call run in the new Scheduler.
declarations.title: observeOn

declarations.comments: Makes subscription happen on a given Scheduler.
declarations.title: subscribeOn

declarations.comments:
Subscribing to an BehaviorSubject is like calling a function, providing
`next`, `error` and `completed` effects to which the data will be delivered.
declarations.title: subscribe

declarations.comments:
Creates an BehaviorSubject that emits the value specify,
and then emits a complete notification.  An alias for `of`.
declarations.title: just

declarations.comments: Send a new value to a BehaviorSubject
declarations.title: next

declarations.comments: An alias for next
declarations.title: send

declarations.comments: Create an Observable from a BehaviorSubject
declarations.title: asObservable

declarations.comments: Obtain the current value of a BehaviorSubject
declarations.title: getValue

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the first BehaviorSubject into an Array, and emits that array only when
second BehaviorSubject emits.
declarations.title: buffer

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the past as an array, emits that array when
its size (arg1) reaches the specified buffer size, and starts a new buffer.
The new buffer starts with nth (arg2) element of the BehaviorSubject counting
from the beginning of the *last* buffer.
declarations.title: bufferCount

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the source BehaviorSubject (arg1) as an array. Starts collecting only when
the opening (arg2) BehaviorSubject emits, and calls the closingSelector function (arg3) to get an BehaviorSubject
that decides when to close the buffer.  Another buffer opens when the
opening BehaviorSubject emits its next value.
declarations.title: bufferToggle

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the past as an array. When it starts collecting values,
it calls a function that returns an BehaviorSubject that emits to close the
buffer and restart collecting.
declarations.title: bufferWhen

declarations.comments:
Equivalent to mergeMap (a.k.a, `>>=`) EXCEPT that, unlike mergeMap,
the next bind will not run until the BehaviorSubject generated by the projection function (arg2)
completes.  That is, composition is sequential, not concurrent.
Warning: if source values arrive endlessly and faster than their corresponding
inner BehaviorSubjects can complete, it will result in memory issues as inner
BehaviorSubjects amass in an unbounded buffer waiting for their turn to be subscribed to.
declarations.title: concatMap

declarations.comments: The type signature explains it best.  Warning: Like `concatMap`, composition is sequential.
declarations.title: concatMapTo

declarations.comments:
It's Like concatMap (a.k.a, `>>=`) EXCEPT that it ignores every new projected
BehaviorSubject if the previous projected BehaviorSubject has not yet completed.
declarations.title: exhaustMap

declarations.comments:
It's similar to mergeMap, but applies the projection function to every source
value as well as every output value. It's recursive.
declarations.title: expand

declarations.comments:
Groups the items emitted by an BehaviorSubject (arg2) according to the value
returned by the grouping function (arg1).  Each group becomes its own
BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: groupBy

declarations.comments:
Emits the given constant value on the output BehaviorSubject every time
the source BehaviorSubject emits a value.
declarations.title: mapTo

declarations.comments:
Maps each value to an BehaviorSubject, then flattens all of these BehaviorSubjects
using mergeAll.  It's just monadic `bind`.
declarations.title: mergeMap

declarations.comments:
Maps each value of the BehaviorSubject (arg1) to the same inner BehaviorSubject (arg2),
then flattens the result.
declarations.title: mergeMapTo

declarations.comments: Puts the current value and previous value together as an array, and emits that.
declarations.title: pairwise

declarations.comments:
Given a predicate function (arg1), and an BehaviorSubject (arg2), it outputs a
two element array of partitioned values
(i.e., [ BehaviorSubject valuesThatPassPredicate, BehaviorSubject valuesThatFailPredicate ]).
declarations.title: partition

declarations.comments:
Given an accumulator function (arg1), an initial value (arg2), and
a source BehaviorSubject (arg3), it returns an BehaviorSubject that emits the current
accumlation whenever the source emits a value.
declarations.title: scan

declarations.comments:
Projects each source value to an BehaviorSubject which is merged in the output
BehaviorSubject, emitting values only from the most recently projected BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: switchMap

declarations.comments: It's like switchMap, but maps each value to the same inner BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: switchMapTo

declarations.comments: It's like buffer, but emits a nested BehaviorSubject instead of an array.
declarations.title: window

declarations.comments: It's like bufferCount, but emits a nested BehaviorSubject instead of an array.
declarations.title: windowCount

declarations.comments:
It's like bufferTime, but emits a nested BehaviorSubject instead of an array,
and it doesn't take a maximum size parameter.  arg1 is how long to
buffer items into a new BehaviorSubject, arg2 is the when the next buffer should begin,
and arg3 is the source BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: windowTime

declarations.comments: It's like bufferToggle, but emits a nested BehaviorSubject instead of an array.
declarations.title: windowToggle

declarations.comments: It's like bufferWhen, but emits a nested BehaviorSubject instead of an array.
declarations.title: windowWhen

declarations.comments: It's like auditTime, but the silencing duration is determined by a second BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: audit

declarations.comments:
Ignores source values for duration milliseconds,
then emits the most recent value from the source BehaviorSubject, then repeats this process.
declarations.title: auditTime

declarations.comments:
It's like debounceTime, but the time span of emission silence is determined
by a second BehaviorSubject.  Allows for a variable debounce rate.
declarations.title: debounce

declarations.comments: It's like delay, but passes only the most recent value from each burst of emissions.
declarations.title: debounceTime

declarations.comments:
Returns an BehaviorSubject that emits all items emitted by the source BehaviorSubject
that are distinct by comparison from previous items.
declarations.title: distinct

declarations.comments:
Returns an BehaviorSubject that emits all items emitted by the source BehaviorSubject
that are distinct by comparison from the previous item.
declarations.title: distinctUntilChanged

declarations.comments:
Emits the single value at the specified index in a sequence of emissions
from the source BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: elementAt

declarations.comments:
Filter items emitted by the source BehaviorSubject by only emitting those that
satisfy a specified predicate.
declarations.title: filter

declarations.comments: Ignores all items emitted by the source BehaviorSubject and only passes calls of complete or error.
declarations.title: ignoreElements

declarations.comments: Returns an BehaviorSubject that emits only the last item emitted by the source BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: last

declarations.comments: It's like sampleTime, but samples whenever the notifier BehaviorSubject emits something.
declarations.title: sample

declarations.comments:
Periodically looks at the source BehaviorSubject and emits whichever
value it has most recently emitted since the previous sampling, unless the source has not emitted anything since the previous sampling.
declarations.title: sampleTime

declarations.comments: Returns an BehaviorSubject that skips n items emitted by an BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: skip

declarations.comments: Returns an BehaviorSubject that skips items emitted by the source BehaviorSubject until a second BehaviorSubject emits an item.
declarations.title: skipUntil

declarations.comments:
Returns an BehaviorSubject that skips all items emitted
by the source BehaviorSubject as long as a specified condition holds true,
but emits all further source items as soon as the condition becomes false.
declarations.title: skipWhile

declarations.comments: Emits only the first n values emitted by the source BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: take

declarations.comments: Lets values pass until a second BehaviorSubject emits something. Then, it completes.
declarations.title: takeUntil

declarations.comments:
Emits values emitted by the source BehaviorSubject so long as each value satisfies
the given predicate, and then completes as soon as this predicate is not satisfied.
declarations.title: takeWhile

declarations.comments: It's like throttleTime, but the silencing duration is determined by a second BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: throttle

declarations.comments:
Emits a value from the source BehaviorSubject, then ignores subsequent source values
for duration milliseconds, then repeats this process.
declarations.title: throttleTime

declarations.comments: An BehaviorSubject of projected values from the most recent values from each input BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: combineLatest

declarations.comments: Concatenates two BehaviorSubjects together by sequentially emitting their values, one BehaviorSubject after the other.
declarations.title: concat

declarations.comments: Converts a higher-order BehaviorSubject into a first-order BehaviorSubject by concatenating the inner BehaviorSubjects in order.
declarations.title: concatAll

declarations.comments:
Flattens an BehaviorSubject-of-BehaviorSubjects by dropping the next inner BehaviorSubjects
while the current inner is still executing.
declarations.title: exhaust

declarations.comments: Creates an output BehaviorSubject which concurrently emits all values from each input BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: merge

declarations.comments:
Converts a higher-order BehaviorSubject into a first-order BehaviorSubject
which concurrently delivers all values that are emitted on the inner BehaviorSubjects.
declarations.title: mergeAll

declarations.comments:
Returns an BehaviorSubject that mirrors the first source BehaviorSubject to emit an
item from the array of BehaviorSubjects.
declarations.title: race

declarations.comments:
Returns an BehaviorSubject that emits the items in the given Array before
it begins to emit items emitted by the source BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: startWith

declarations.comments:
Combines each value from the source BehaviorSubjects using a project function to
determine the value to be emitted on the output BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: withLatestFrom

declarations.comments:
Waits for each BehaviorSubject to emit a value. Once this occurs, all values
with the corresponding index will be emitted. This will continue until at
least one inner BehaviorSubject completes.
declarations.title: zip

declarations.comments:
If the source BehaviorSubject calls error, this method will resubscribe to the
source BehaviorSubject n times rather than propagating the error call.
declarations.title: retry

declarations.comments: Time shifts each item by some specified amount of milliseconds.
declarations.title: delay

declarations.comments:
Delays the emission of items from the source BehaviorSubject by a given time
span determined by the emissions of another BehaviorSubject.
declarations.title: delayWhen

declarations.comments:
Performs the effect on each value of the BehaviorSubject.  An alias for `do`.
Useful for testing (transparently performing an effect outside of a subscription).
declarations.title: performEach

declarations.comments: Counts the number of emissions on the source and emits that number when the source completes.
declarations.title: count

children.comments: NOTE: The semigroup instance uses `merge` NOT `concat`.
children.title: semigroupObservable

declarations.comments:
*Note*: A couple operators are not wrapped (namely, `bindCallback`, `bindNodeCallback`) because RxJS
implementation details prevent giving the operators an "honest" PureScript type.
However, such operators are replaced easily using `Aff` with the `AsyncSubject` module.
Please see [RxJS Version 5.* documentation](http://reactivex.io/rxjs/) for
additional details on proper usage of the library.
declarations.title: Observable

declarations.comments: Makes every `next` call run in the new Scheduler.
declarations.title: observeOn

declarations.comments: Makes subscription happen on a given Scheduler.
declarations.title: subscribeOn

declarations.comments:
Subscribing to an Observable is like calling a function, providing
`next`, `error` and `completed` effects to which the data will be delivered.
declarations.title: subscribe

declarations.comments:
Creates an Observable from an Array.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/from.png)
declarations.title: fromArray

declarations.comments: Creates an Observable that emits events of the specified type coming from the given event target.
declarations.title: fromEvent

declarations.comments:
Returns an Observable that emits an infinite sequence of ascending
integers, with a constant interval of time of your choosing between those
emissions.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/interval.png)
declarations.title: interval

declarations.comments:
Creates an Observable that emits the value specify,
and then emits a complete notification.  An alias for `of`.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/from.png)
declarations.title: just

declarations.comments:
Creates an Observable that emits no items.  Subscriptions it must be
disposed manually.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/never.png)
declarations.title: never

declarations.comments:
The range operator emits a range of sequential integers, in order, where
you select the start of the range and its length
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/rxjs/img/range.png" width="640" height="195">
declarations.title: range

declarations.comments: Creates an Observable that immediately sends an error notification.
declarations.title: throw

declarations.comments:
Creates an Observable that, upon subscription, emits and infinite sequence of ascending integers,
after a specified delay, every specified period.  Delay and period are in
milliseconds.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/timer.png)
declarations.title: timer

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the first Observable into an Array, and emits that array only when
second Observable emits.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/documentation/operators/images/buffer1.png)
declarations.title: buffer

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the past as an array, emits that array when
its size (arg1) reaches the specified buffer size, and starts a new buffer.
The new buffer starts with nth (arg2) element of the Observable counting
from the beginning of the *last* buffer.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/documentation/operators/images/buffer1.png)
declarations.title: bufferCount

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the source Observable (arg1) as an array. Starts collecting only when
the opening (arg2) Observable emits, and calls the closingSelector function (arg3) to get an Observable
that decides when to close the buffer.  Another buffer opens when the
opening Observable emits its next value.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/documentation/operators/images/buffer2.png)
declarations.title: bufferToggle

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the past as an array. When it starts collecting values,
it calls a function that returns an Observable that emits to close the
buffer and restart collecting.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/documentation/operators/images/buffer1.png)
declarations.title: bufferWhen

declarations.comments:
Equivalent to mergeMap (a.k.a, `>>=`) EXCEPT that, unlike mergeMap,
the next bind will not run until the Observable generated by the projection function (arg2)
completes.  That is, composition is sequential, not concurrent.
Warning: if source values arrive endlessly and faster than their corresponding
inner Observables can complete, it will result in memory issues as inner
Observables amass in an unbounded buffer waiting for their turn to be subscribed to.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/concatMap.png)
declarations.title: concatMap

declarations.comments:
The type signature explains it best.  Warning: Like `concatMap`, composition is sequential.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/concatMap.png)
declarations.title: concatMapTo

declarations.comments:
It's Like concatMap (a.k.a, `>>=`) EXCEPT that it ignores every new projected
Observable if the previous projected Observable has not yet completed.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/rxjs/img/exhaustMap.png)
declarations.title: exhaustMap

declarations.comments:
It's similar to mergeMap, but applies the projection function to every source
value as well as every output value. It's recursive.
declarations.title: expand

declarations.comments:
Groups the items emitted by an Observable (arg2) according to the value
returned by the grouping function (arg1).  Each group becomes its own
Observable.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/groupBy.png)
declarations.title: groupBy

declarations.comments:
Emits the given constant value on the output Observable every time
the source Observable emits a value.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/map.png)
declarations.title: mapTo

declarations.comments:
Maps each value to an Observable, then flattens all of these Observables
using mergeAll.  It's just monadic `bind`.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/documentation/operators/images/flatMap.c.png)
declarations.title: mergeMap

declarations.comments:
Maps each value of the Observable (arg1) to the same inner Observable (arg2),
then flattens the result.
 ![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/documentation/operators/images/flatMap.c.png)
declarations.title: mergeMapTo

declarations.comments:
Puts the current value and previous value together as an array, and emits that.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/rxjs/img/pairwise.png)
declarations.title: pairwise

declarations.comments:
Given a predicate function (arg1), and an Observable (arg2), it outputs a
two element array of partitioned values
(i.e., [ Observable valuesThatPassPredicate, Observable valuesThatFailPredicate ]).
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/rxjs/img/partition.png)
declarations.title: partition

declarations.comments:
Given an accumulator function (arg1), an initial value (arg2), and
a source Observable (arg3), it returns an Observable that emits the current
accumlation whenever the source emits a value.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/scanSeed.png)
declarations.title: scan

declarations.comments:
Projects each source value to an Observable which is merged in the output
Observable, emitting values only from the most recently projected Observable.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/switchMap.png)
declarations.title: switchMap

declarations.comments:
It's like switchMap, but maps each value to the same inner Observable.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/switchMap.png)
declarations.title: switchMapTo

declarations.comments:
It's like buffer, but emits a nested Observable instead of an array.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/window8.png)
declarations.title: window

declarations.comments: It's like bufferCount, but emits a nested Observable instead of an array.
declarations.title: windowCount

declarations.comments:
It's like bufferTime, but emits a nested Observable instead of an array,
and it doesn't take a maximum size parameter.  arg1 is how long to
buffer items into a new Observable, arg2 is the when the next buffer should begin,
and arg3 is the source Observable.
declarations.title: windowTime

declarations.comments: It's like bufferToggle, but emits a nested Observable instead of an array.
declarations.title: windowToggle

declarations.comments: It's like bufferWhen, but emits a nested Observable instead of an array.
declarations.title: windowWhen

declarations.comments:
It's like auditTime, but the silencing duration is determined by a second Observable.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/rxjs/img/audit.png)
declarations.title: audit

declarations.comments:
Ignores source values for duration milliseconds,
then emits the most recent value from the source Observable, then repeats this process.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/rxjs/img/auditTime.png)
declarations.title: auditTime

declarations.comments:
It's like debounceTime, but the time span of emission silence is determined
by a second Observable.  Allows for a variable debounce rate.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/debounce.f.png)
declarations.title: debounce

declarations.comments: It's like delay, but passes only the most recent value from each burst of emissions.
declarations.title: debounceTime

declarations.comments:
Returns an Observable that emits all items emitted by the source Observable
that are distinct by comparison from previous items.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/documentation/operators/images/distinct.png)
declarations.title: distinct

declarations.comments:
Returns an Observable that emits all items emitted by the source Observable
that are distinct by comparison from the previous item.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/distinctUntilChanged.key.png)
declarations.title: distinctUntilChanged

declarations.comments:
Emits the single value at the specified index in a sequence of emissions
from the source Observable.
declarations.title: elementAt

declarations.comments:
Filter items emitted by the source Observable by only emitting those that
satisfy a specified predicate.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/filter.png)
declarations.title: filter

declarations.comments:
Ignores all items emitted by the source Observable and only passes calls of complete or error.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/rxjs/img/ignoreElements.png)
declarations.title: ignoreElements

declarations.comments:
Returns an Observable that emits only the last item emitted by the source
Observable that that satisfies the given predicate.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/last.png)
declarations.title: last

declarations.comments:
It's like sampleTime, but samples whenever the notifier Observable emits something.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/sample.o.png)
declarations.title: sample

declarations.comments:
Periodically looks at the source Observable and emits whichever
value it has most recently emitted since the previous sampling, unless the source has not emitted anything since the previous sampling.
declarations.title: sampleTime

declarations.comments:
Returns an Observable that skips n items emitted by an Observable.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/skip.png)
declarations.title: skip

declarations.comments:
Returns an Observable that skips items emitted by the source Observable until a second Observable emits an item.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/skipUntil.png)
declarations.title: skipUntil

declarations.comments:
Returns an Observable that skips all items emitted
by the source Observable as long as a specified condition holds true,
but emits all further source items as soon as the condition becomes false.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/skipWhile.png)
declarations.title: skipWhile

declarations.comments:
Emits only the first n values emitted by the source Observable.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/take.png)
declarations.title: take

declarations.comments:
Lets values pass until a second Observable emits something. Then, it completes.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/takeUntil.png" alt=""
declarations.title: takeUntil

declarations.comments:
Emits values emitted by the source Observable so long as each value satisfies
the given predicate, and then completes as soon as this predicate is not satisfied.
declarations.title: takeWhile

declarations.comments:
It's like throttleTime, but the silencing duration is determined by a second Observable.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/rxjs/img/throttle.png" width="640" height="195">
declarations.title: throttle

declarations.comments:
Emits a value from the source Observable, then ignores subsequent source values
for duration milliseconds, then repeats this process.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/throttleWithTimeout.png)
declarations.title: throttleTime

declarations.comments:
An Observable of projected values from the most recent values from each input Observable.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/documentation/operators/images/combineLatest.png)
declarations.title: combineLatest

declarations.comments:
Concatenates two Observables together by sequentially emitting their values, one Observable after the other.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/concat.png)
declarations.title: concat

declarations.comments:
Converts a higher-order Observable into a first-order Observable by concatenating the inner Observables in order.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/concat.png)
declarations.title: concatAll

declarations.comments:
Flattens an Observable-of-Observables by dropping the next inner Observables
while the current inner is still executing.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/rxjs/img/exhaust.png)
declarations.title: exhaust

declarations.comments:
Creates an output Observable which concurrently emits all values from each input Observable.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/merge.png)
declarations.title: merge

declarations.comments:
Converts a higher-order Observable into a first-order Observable
which concurrently delivers all values that are emitted on the inner Observables.
![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/documentation/operators/images/mergeAll.png)
declarations.title: mergeAll

declarations.comments:
Returns an Observable that mirrors the first source Observable to emit an
item from the array of Observables.
declarations.title: race

declarations.comments:
Returns an Observable that emits the items in the given Foldable before
it begins to emit items emitted by the source Observable.
declarations.title: startWithMany

declarations.comments:
Returns an Observable that emits the item given before
it begins to emit items emitted by the source Observable.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/startWith.png)
declarations.title: startWith

declarations.comments:
Combines each value from the source Observables using a project function to
determine the value to be emitted on the output Observable.
![marble diagram](https://raw.github.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/withLatestFrom.png" alt="">
declarations.title: withLatestFrom

declarations.comments:
Waits for each Observable to emit a value. Once this occurs, all values
with the corresponding index will be emitted. This will continue until at
least one inner observable completes.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/zip.i.png)
declarations.title: zip

declarations.comments: ![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/documentation/operators/images/catch.js.png)
declarations.title: catch

declarations.comments:
If the source Observable calls error, this method will resubscribe to the
source Observable n times rather than propagating the error call.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/retry.png)
declarations.title: retry

declarations.comments:
Time shifts each item by some specified amount of milliseconds.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/delay.png)
declarations.title: delay

declarations.comments:
Delays the emission of items from the source Observable by a given time
span determined by the emissions of another Observable.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/delay.o.png)
declarations.title: delayWhen

declarations.comments:
Returns an Observable that reverses the effect of `materialize` by
`Notification` objects emitted by the source Observable into the items
or notifications they represent.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/dematerialize.png)
declarations.title: dematerialize

declarations.comments:
Turns all of the notifications from a source Observable into onNext emissions,
and marks them with their original notification types within `Notification` objects.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/materialize.png)
declarations.title: materialize

declarations.comments:
Performs the effect on each value of the Observable.  An alias for `do`.
Useful for testing (transparently performing an effect outside of a subscription).
declarations.title: performEach

declarations.comments:
Returns an Observable that emits a single item, a list composed of all the items emitted by the source Observable.
![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/toList.png)
declarations.title: toArray

declarations.comments:
Returns an Observable that emits the items emitted by the source Observable or a specified default item
if the source Observable is empty.

![marble diagram](http://reactivex.io/documentation/operators/images/defaultIfEmpty.c.png)

takes a defaultValue which is the item to emit if the source Observable emits no items.

returns an Observable that emits either the specified default item if the source Observable emits no
        items, or the items emitted by the source Observable
declarations.title: defaultIfEmpty

declarations.comments:
Determines whether all elements of an observable sequence satisfy a condition.
Returns an observable sequence containing a single element determining whether all
elements in the source sequence pass the test in the specified predicate.
declarations.title: every

declarations.comments:
Tests whether this `Observable` emits no elements.

returns an Observable emitting one single Boolean, which is `true` if this `Observable`
        emits no elements, and `false` otherwise.
declarations.title: isEmpty

declarations.comments:
Returns a new Observable that multicasts (shares) the original Observable. As long a
there is more than 1 Subscriber, this Observable will be subscribed and emitting data.
When all subscribers have unsubscribed it will unsubscribe from the source Observable.

This is an alias for `publish().refCount()`

![marble diagram](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/ReactiveX/RxJava/images/rx-operators/publishRefCount.png)

returns an Observable that upon connection causes the source Observable to emit items to its Subscribers
declarations.title: share

declarations.comments:
Returns an Observable that emits only the first item emitted by the source
Observable that satisfies the given predicate.
declarations.title: first

declarations.comments: Counts the number of emissions on the source and emits that number when the source completes.
declarations.title: count

declarations.comments:
Applies an accumulator function over the source Observable, and returns the accumulated
result when the source completes, given a seed value.
declarations.title: reduce

declarations.comments: Run an Observable of effects
declarations.title: unwrap

children.comments: NOTE: The semigroup instance uses `merge` NOT `concat`.
children.title: semigroupReplaySubject

declarations.comments:
Please see [RxJS Version 5.* documentation](http://reactivex.io/rxjs/) for
additional details on proper usage of the library.
declarations.title: ReplaySubject

declarations.comments: Makes every `next` call run in the new Scheduler.
declarations.title: observeOn

declarations.comments: Makes subscription happen on a given Scheduler.
declarations.title: subscribeOn

declarations.comments:
Subscribing to an ReplaySubject is like calling a function, providing
`next`, `error` and `completed` effects to which the data will be delivered.
declarations.title: subscribe

declarations.comments:
Creates an ReplaySubject that emits the value specify,
and then emits a complete notification.  An alias for `of`.
declarations.title: just

declarations.comments: Send a new value to a ReplaySubject
declarations.title: next

declarations.comments: An alias for next
declarations.title: send

declarations.comments: Create an Observable from a ReplaySubject
declarations.title: asObservable

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the first ReplaySubject into an Array, and emits that array only when
second ReplaySubject emits.
declarations.title: buffer

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the past as an array, emits that array when
its size (arg1) reaches the specified buffer size, and starts a new buffer.
The new buffer starts with nth (arg2) element of the ReplaySubject counting
from the beginning of the *last* buffer.
declarations.title: bufferCount

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the source ReplaySubject (arg1) as an array. Starts collecting only when
the opening (arg2) ReplaySubject emits, and calls the closingSelector function (arg3) to get an ReplaySubject
that decides when to close the buffer.  Another buffer opens when the
opening ReplaySubject emits its next value.
declarations.title: bufferToggle

declarations.comments:
Collects values from the past as an array. When it starts collecting values,
it calls a function that returns an ReplaySubject that emits to close the
buffer and restart collecting.
declarations.title: bufferWhen

declarations.comments:
Equivalent to mergeMap (a.k.a, `>>=`) EXCEPT that, unlike mergeMap,
the next bind will not run until the ReplaySubject generated by the projection function (arg2)
completes.  That is, composition is sequential, not concurrent.
Warning: if source values arrive endlessly and faster than their corresponding
inner ReplaySubjects can complete, it will result in memory issues as inner
ReplaySubjects amass in an unbounded buffer waiting for their turn to be subscribed to.
declarations.title: concatMap

declarations.comments: The type signature explains it best.  Warning: Like `concatMap`, composition is sequential.
declarations.title: concatMapTo

declarations.comments:
It's Like concatMap (a.k.a, `>>=`) EXCEPT that it ignores every new projected
ReplaySubject if the previous projected ReplaySubject has not yet completed.
declarations.title: exhaustMap

declarations.comments:
It's similar to mergeMap, but applies the projection function to every source
value as well as every output value. It's recursive.
declarations.title: expand

declarations.comments:
Groups the items emitted by an ReplaySubject (arg2) according to the value
returned by the grouping function (arg1).  Each group becomes its own
ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: groupBy

declarations.comments:
Emits the given constant value on the output ReplaySubject every time
the source ReplaySubject emits a value.
declarations.title: mapTo

declarations.comments:
Maps each value to an ReplaySubject, then flattens all of these ReplaySubjects
using mergeAll.  It's just monadic `bind`.
declarations.title: mergeMap

declarations.comments:
Maps each value of the ReplaySubject (arg1) to the same inner ReplaySubject (arg2),
then flattens the result.
declarations.title: mergeMapTo

declarations.comments: Puts the current value and previous value together as an array, and emits that.
declarations.title: pairwise

declarations.comments:
Given a predicate function (arg1), and an ReplaySubject (arg2), it outputs a
two element array of partitioned values
(i.e., [ ReplaySubject valuesThatPassPredicate, ReplaySubject valuesThatFailPredicate ]).
declarations.title: partition

declarations.comments:
Given an accumulator function (arg1), an initial value (arg2), and
a source ReplaySubject (arg3), it returns an ReplaySubject that emits the current
accumlation whenever the source emits a value.
declarations.title: scan

declarations.comments:
Projects each source value to an ReplaySubject which is merged in the output
ReplaySubject, emitting values only from the most recently projected ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: switchMap

declarations.comments: It's like switchMap, but maps each value to the same inner ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: switchMapTo

declarations.comments: It's like buffer, but emits a nested ReplaySubject instead of an array.
declarations.title: window

declarations.comments: It's like bufferCount, but emits a nested ReplaySubject instead of an array.
declarations.title: windowCount

declarations.comments:
It's like bufferTime, but emits a nested ReplaySubject instead of an array,
and it doesn't take a maximum size parameter.  arg1 is how long to
buffer items into a new ReplaySubject, arg2 is the when the next buffer should begin,
and arg3 is the source ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: windowTime

declarations.comments: It's like bufferToggle, but emits a nested ReplaySubject instead of an array.
declarations.title: windowToggle

declarations.comments: It's like bufferWhen, but emits a nested ReplaySubject instead of an array.
declarations.title: windowWhen

declarations.comments: It's like auditTime, but the silencing duration is determined by a second ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: audit

declarations.comments:
Ignores source values for duration milliseconds,
then emits the most recent value from the source ReplaySubject, then repeats this process.
declarations.title: auditTime

declarations.comments:
It's like debounceTime, but the time span of emission silence is determined
by a second ReplaySubject.  Allows for a variable debounce rate.
declarations.title: debounce

declarations.comments: It's like delay, but passes only the most recent value from each burst of emissions.
declarations.title: debounceTime

declarations.comments:
Returns an ReplaySubject that emits all items emitted by the source ReplaySubject
that are distinct by comparison from previous items.
declarations.title: distinct

declarations.comments:
Returns an ReplaySubject that emits all items emitted by the source ReplaySubject
that are distinct by comparison from the previous item.
declarations.title: distinctUntilChanged

declarations.comments:
Emits the single value at the specified index in a sequence of emissions
from the source ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: elementAt

declarations.comments:
Filter items emitted by the source ReplaySubject by only emitting those that
satisfy a specified predicate.
declarations.title: filter

declarations.comments: Ignores all items emitted by the source ReplaySubject and only passes calls of complete or error.
declarations.title: ignoreElements

declarations.comments: Returns an ReplaySubject that emits only the last item emitted by the source ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: last

declarations.comments: It's like sampleTime, but samples whenever the notifier ReplaySubject emits something.
declarations.title: sample

declarations.comments:
Periodically looks at the source ReplaySubject and emits whichever
value it has most recently emitted since the previous sampling, unless the source has not emitted anything since the previous sampling.
declarations.title: sampleTime

declarations.comments: Returns an ReplaySubject that skips n items emitted by an ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: skip

declarations.comments: Returns an ReplaySubject that skips items emitted by the source ReplaySubject until a second ReplaySubject emits an item.
declarations.title: skipUntil

declarations.comments:
Returns an ReplaySubject that skips all items emitted
by the source ReplaySubject as long as a specified condition holds true,
but emits all further source items as soon as the condition becomes false.
declarations.title: skipWhile

declarations.comments: Emits only the first n values emitted by the source ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: take

declarations.comments: Lets values pass until a second ReplaySubject emits something. Then, it completes.
declarations.title: takeUntil

declarations.comments:
Emits values emitted by the source ReplaySubject so long as each value satisfies
the given predicate, and then completes as soon as this predicate is not satisfied.
declarations.title: takeWhile

declarations.comments: It's like throttleTime, but the silencing duration is determined by a second ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: throttle

declarations.comments:
Emits a value from the source ReplaySubject, then ignores subsequent source values
for duration milliseconds, then repeats this process.
declarations.title: throttleTime

declarations.comments: An ReplaySubject of projected values from the most recent values from each input ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: combineLatest

declarations.comments: Concatenates two ReplaySubjects together by sequentially emitting their values, one ReplaySubject after the other.
declarations.title: concat

declarations.comments: Converts a higher-order ReplaySubject into a first-order ReplaySubject by concatenating the inner ReplaySubjects in order.
declarations.title: concatAll

declarations.comments:
Flattens an ReplaySubject-of-ReplaySubjects by dropping the next inner ReplaySubjects
while the current inner is still executing.
declarations.title: exhaust

declarations.comments: Creates an output ReplaySubject which concurrently emits all values from each input ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: merge

declarations.comments:
Converts a higher-order ReplaySubject into a first-order ReplaySubject
which concurrently delivers all values that are emitted on the inner ReplaySubjects.
declarations.title: mergeAll

declarations.comments:
Returns an ReplaySubject that mirrors the first source ReplaySubject to emit an
item from the array of ReplaySubjects.
declarations.title: race

declarations.comments:
Returns an ReplaySubject that emits the items in the given Array before
it begins to emit items emitted by the source ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: startWith

declarations.comments:
Combines each value from the source ReplaySubjects using a project function to
determine the value to be emitted on the output ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: withLatestFrom

declarations.comments:
Waits for each ReplaySubject to emit a value. Once this occurs, all values
with the corresponding index will be emitted. This will continue until at
least one inner ReplaySubject completes.
declarations.title: zip

declarations.comments:
If the source ReplaySubject calls error, this method will resubscribe to the
source ReplaySubject n times rather than propagating the error call.
declarations.title: retry

declarations.comments: Time shifts each item by some specified amount of milliseconds.
declarations.title: delay

declarations.comments:
Delays the emission of items from the source ReplaySubject by a given time
span determined by the emissions of another ReplaySubject.
declarations.title: delayWhen

declarations.comments:
Performs the effect on each value of the ReplaySubject.  An alias for `do`.
Useful for testing (transparently performing an effect outside of a subscription).
declarations.title: performEach

declarations.comments: Counts the number of emissions on the source and emits that number when the source completes.
declarations.title: count

declarations.comments:
Please see [RxJS Version 5.* documentation](http://reactivex.io/rxjs/) for
additional details on proper usage of the library.
declarations.title: Scheduler

declarations.comments:
When you subscribe, you get back a Subscription, which represents the
ongoing execution.
declarations.title: Subscription

declarations.comments: Call unsubscribe() to cancel the execution.
declarations.title: unsubscribe
